Use case: Identify the project with the context in which it was developped

Thing: software entity metadata record in a registry
Use case: Cite a piece of software with the right credit for the people involved in the software
Use and contribute to the software on the working repository
Contribute to the main project via pull requests, or reuse with modifications

Thing: software landing page (Web page describing the software)
Use case: Discover software and complementary information about the software
Rebuild the software from sources
Install and run the software

Thing: software image of a version for an environment (executable)
Use case: Install and run the software
Understand the software with its detailed explanantion in a research context
Understand how to use the software
Learn to use the software
Contribute to the development of the software
Compile and run the software
Visualize the software
Archive and reference a software bundle
Identify and reference the state of the development of the software (source code with all the branches and tags for all the versions)

Thing: software source code element (release, revision, directory)
Use case: Identify and reference the specific part of the development history- a release tagged with a comment, a revision (a.k.a a commit), a directory in the source code tree

Thing: software source code file (a specific leaf in the tree)
Use case: Identify and reference the source code file

Thing: software source code algorithm (lines of code in a file in the tree)
Use case: Identify and reference a specific algorithm inside a file
Cite the software with the instructions from the author (sometimes not compliant with software citation principles)
